etymology.description: Depicts a container -> standardized container or box
etymology.interpretation: The character 匚 (fāng, "box") visually represents a container, highlighting its function as an enclosing object, which naturally associates it with the idea of a box or receptacle.

examples.chinese: 工厂里堆放着破旧的匚(工廠裡堆放著破舊的匚)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngchǎng lǐ duīfàng zhe pòjiù de fāng.
examples.english: Old boxes are piled up in the factory.

examples.chinese: 妈妈买了新的匚(媽媽買了新的匚)，用来收纳宝贝的玩具(用來收納寶貝的玩具)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā mǎile xīn de fāng, yòng lái shōunà bǎobèi de wánjù.
examples.english: Mom bought a new box to store her child's toys.

examples.chinese: 艺术家设计了独特形状的匚(藝術家設計了獨特形狀的匚)，确保每件作品安全保存(確保每件作品安全保存)。
examples.pinyin: Yìshùjiā shèjì le dútè xíngzhuàng de fāng, quèbǎo měi jiàn zuòpǐn ānquán bǎocún.
examples.english: The artist designed uniquely shaped boxes to ensure each work was safely stored.
